place.name: Andoran
sections: Fledgling democracy in pursuit of freedom for all.

sections.name: Government
sections.entry: The People's Council (parliamentary democracy)

sections.name: Population
sections.entry: humans (Taldan), halflings, kobolds, dwarves

sections.name: Languages
sections.entry: {@language Common}

sections.name: Religions
sections.entry: {@deity Abadar}, {@deity Cayden Cailean}, {@deity Erastil}, {@deity Iomedae}, {@deity Shelyn}

sections.name: Primary Exports
sections.entry: ancient treasures and artifacts, financial credit, lumber, minerals

sections.name: Enemies
sections.entry: autocratic governments concerned about potential domestic revolts, Cheliax, Katapesh, slavers

sections.name: Factions
sections.entry: Bellflower Network, Eagle Knights, Lumber Consortium

sections.name: Threats
sections.entry: rising aggression from Cheliax, retaliation from slavers, corruption among elected officials

sections.name: Andira Marusek
sections.entry: ({@trait LG} female human warrior) Supreme Elect of the Executive Office and mayor of Almas

sections.name: Reginald Cormoth
sections.entry: ({@trait LG} male human commander) Eagle Knight Commander General

sections.name: Felandriel Morgethai
sections.entry: ({@trait CG} female elf wizard) Almas University provost

place.name: Rahadoum
sections: Desert nation unified by a humanistic worldview and rejection of religion.

sections.name: Government
sections.entry: Council of Elders (representative council)

sections.name: Population
sections.entry: humans (Garundi, Mauxi)

sections.name: Languages
sections.entry: {@language Common}, Osiriani

sections.name: Religions
sections.entry: Laws of Mortality

sections.name: Prohibited
sections.entry: all divine religions

sections.name: Irreligious
sections.entry: All worship of deities is prohibited by Rahadoumi law. Religious symbols and items are confiscated and proselytization incurs a heavy fine. Rahadoumi citizens perform healing through only mundane means or non-divine magic.

sections.name: Primary Exports
sections.entry: base metals, fine cloth, gemstones, herbal remedies, mechanical innovations, produce, salt, tools

sections.name: Primary Imports
sections.entry: lumber, pesh

sections.name: Enemies
sections.entry: pirates of the Shackles, Red Mantis, religious groups

sections.name: Factions
sections.entry: Aspis Consortium, Pure Legion

sections.name: Threats
sections.entry: conflict among neighboring nations, desert-dwelling monsters, disease, rapidly accelerating desertification

sections.name: Malduoni
sections.entry: ({@trait LN} male human politician) Keeper of the First Law, elected by the Council of Elders

sections.name: Kassi Aziril
sections.entry: ({@trait NG} female human doctor) "Mother of Modern Medicine," renowned medical researcher and philanthropist

sections.name: Salim Ghadafar
sections.entry: ({@trait LN} male human inquisitor) former Pure Legion captain forced into Pharasma's service

place.name: Port Peril
sections: Pirate city and black-market capital of the Shackles.

sections.name: Government
sections.entry: Hurricane Queen (overlord)

sections.name: Population
sections.entry: 43,270 (65% humans, 10% half-elves, 8% half-orcs, 5% gnomes, 5% halflings, 7% other)

sections.name: Languages
sections.entry: {@language Common}, Kelish, Osiriani

sections.name: Religions
sections.entry: {@deity Besmara}, {@deity Cayden Cailean}, {@deity Gozreh}

sections.name: Threats
sections.entry: anti-pirate policing from the Inner Sea region, opposing pirate forces, supernatural storms from the Eye of Abendego

sections.name: Pirate Town
sections.entry: Port Peril thrives on black-market and stolen goods. Items that might be difficult to acquire or dispose of in other settlements due to legality can be purchased and sold more easily in Port Peril. NPCs begin with an attitude one step worse than usual toward characters openly displaying insignia of law-enforcement agencies, religious iconography of lawful deities, or affiliation with a lawful nation.

sections.name: Pherias Jakar
sections.entry: ({@trait CN} female elf troubadour) merchant master and joint overseer of Port Peril

sections.name: Sabas Odabio
sections.entry: ({@trait LN} male human administrator) accountant and joint overseer of Port Peril

sections.name: Tessa Fairwind
sections.entry: ({@trait CN} female half-elf pirate lord) Hurricane Queen of the Shackles

sections.name: Tsojmin Kreidoros
sections.entry: ({@trait LE} male dwarf wizard) harbormaster and joint overseer of Port Peril

place.name: Otari
sections: Diverse lumber town and trade port with a storied past and a fair share of sinister secrets.

sections.name: Government
sections.entry: Mayor (elected leader)

sections.name: Population
sections.entry: 1,240 (60% humans, 8% halflings, 7% half-elves, 6% elves, 5% dwarves, 5% gnomes, 3% half-orcs, 2% goblins, 4% other)

sections.name: Languages
sections.entry: {@language Common}, {@language Dwarven}, {@language Elven}, {@language Gnomish}, {@language Halfling}

sections.name: Religions
sections.entry: {@deity Cayden Cailean}, {@deity Erastil}, {@deity Gozreh}, {@deity Nethys}, {@deity Sarenrae}

sections.name: Threats
sections.entry: aberrant horrors, eerie hauntings, kobolds, smugglers

sections.name: Trinket Trade
sections.entry: Otari has a long tradition of catering to adventurers, and consumable items of up to level 10 can be purchased in its markets ands shops.

sections.name: Lardus Longsaddle
sections.entry: ({@trait CN} male human soldier) foul-mouthed and short-tempered captain of the town guard

sections.name: Oseph Menhemes
sections.entry: ({@trait N} male human mayor) current mayor of Otari, patriarch of one of three local lumber companies

sections.name: Vandy Banderdash
sections.entry: ({@trait NG} female halfling cleric) chatty priestess of Sarenrae and unusually knowledgeable town historian

sections.name: Wrin Sivinxi
sections.entry: ({@trait CG} female tiefling merchant) eccentric occult items dealer, artisan, and collector of stories and rumors

place.name: Material Plane

sections.name: Category
sections.entry: Inner Plane

sections.name: Divinities
sections.entry: {@filter Elder Mythos pantheon|deities|Pantheon=Elder Mythos}, {@deity Gozreh}

sections.name: Native Inhabitants
sections.entry: Inner Plane

sections: The Material Plane is the prosaic universe and the home  of mortal life. Innumerable galaxies play host to countless  stars and their planets, each housing unique settings for any  campaign, with Golarion as the classic example. Other worlds of  note like Castrovel, Akiton, and Eox exist within Golarion's own  solar system, and then beyond this, orbiting other distant stars  or in other galaxies still, worlds such as Androffa, Carcosa, and  even Earth swirl within the Material Plane's vast and silent void.

Yet for all the profound wonder and diversity of life that the  Material Plane houses, in the dark places between the stars,  known as the Dark Tapestry, lurk the inimical gods known  as the Outer Gods and Great Old Ones, the sinister collective  known as the Dominion of the Black.

The Material Plane serves as the destination for pre-incarnate  souls, each mortal life born, living, and dying before sending its  spirit toward the planes of the Outer Sphere for judgment. The  Material Plane is likewise the focus of the gods, each of whom is  invested in fostering their own particular portfolio among mortal  worshippers and the material world at large.
